content.description: <math alttext="2 N O 2 reacts to produce, N O 3 plus N O, which is the slow step" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mo>(</mo><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mtext>slow</mtext></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: <math alttext="N O 3 reacts to produce, N O plus O 2, which is the fast step" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mo>(</mo><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mtext>fast</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> A proposed two-step mechanism for the reaction <math alttext="2 N O 2 reacts to produce, 2 N O plus O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mtext>NO</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is represented. Which of the following rate laws is consistent with the mechanism?

choices.label: <math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of N O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of N O 2, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of N O 2, squared, times the molar concentration of N O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="rate equals k times the fraction with numerator the molar concentration of N O, squared, times the molar concentration of O 2, and denominator the molar concentration of N O 2, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>NO</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of N O 2, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
